member.name: T:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Logging.ILog
member.summary: Simple interface that represent a logger.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Logging.ILog.Log(CodeProject.ObjectPool.Logging.LogLevel,System.Func{System.String},System.Exception,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a message the specified log level.
member.param: Optional format parameters for the message generated by the messagefunc.
member.returns: true if the message was logged. Otherwise false.
member.remarks:
Note to implementers: the message func should not be called if the loglevel is not enabled so as not to incur performance penalties.
To check IsEnabled call Log with only LogLevel and check the return value, no event will be written.

member.name: T:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Logging.LogLevel
member.summary: The log level.

member.name: T:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Logging.LogProviders.LoupeLogProvider.WriteDelegate
member.summary: The form of the Loupe Log.Write method we're using

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Logging.LogProviders.LoupeLogProvider.ProviderIsAvailableOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether [provider is available override]. Used in tests.
member.value: true if [provider is available override]; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary:
Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number.
"Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.

member.name: T:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics
member.summary: A simple class to track stats during execution. By default, this class does not record anything, since its property is set to false.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new diagnostics object, ready to record Object Pool main events.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this object can record data about how the Pool operates.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.TotalLiveInstancesCount
member.summary: Gets the total count of live instances, both in the pool and in use.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.ObjectResetFailedCount
member.summary: Gets the count of object reset failures occured while the pool tried to re-add the object into the pool.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.ReturnedToPoolByResurrectionCount
member.summary: Gets the total count of object that has been picked up by the GC, and returned to pool.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.PoolObjectHitCount
member.summary: Gets the total count of successful accesses. The pool had a spare object to provide to the user without creating it on demand.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.PoolObjectMissCount
member.summary: Gets the total count of unsuccessful accesses. The pool had to create an object in order to satisfy the user request.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.TotalInstancesCreated
member.summary: Gets the total number of pooled objected created.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.TotalInstancesDestroyed
member.summary: Gets the total number of objects destroyes, both in case of an pool overflow, and state corruption.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.PoolOverflowCount
member.summary: Gets the number of objects been destroyed because the pool was full at the time of returning the object to the pool.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.ReturnedToPoolCount
member.summary: Gets the total count of objects that been successfully returned to the pool.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementObjectsCreatedCount
member.summary: Increments the objects created count.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementObjectsDestroyedCount
member.summary: Increments the objects destroyed count.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementPoolObjectHitCount
member.summary: Increments the pool object hit count.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementPoolObjectMissCount
member.summary: Increments the pool object miss count.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementPoolOverflowCount
member.summary: Increments the pool overflow count.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementResetStateFailedCount
member.summary: Increments the reset state failed count.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementObjectResurrectionCount
member.summary: Increments the count of objects returned to pool by resurrection.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.ObjectPoolDiagnostics.IncrementReturnedToPoolCount
member.summary: Increments the returned to pool count.

member.name: T:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1
member.summary: A buffer into which pooled objects are stored. This buffer mostly behaves like a queue, even if that behaviour is not stricly respected in order to maximize performance.
member.typeparam: The type of the object that which will be managed by the pool. The pooled object have to be a sub-class of PooledObject.

member.name: F:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.NoObjects
member.summary: Used as default value for .

member.name: F:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1._pooledObjects
member.summary: The concurrent buffer containing pooled objects.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.Capacity
member.summary: The maximum capacity of this buffer.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.Count
member.summary: The number of objects stored in this buffer.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: An enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a collection.
member.returns: An object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.TryDequeue(`0@)
member.summary: Tries to dequeue an object from the buffer.
member.returns: True if has a value, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.TryEnqueue(`0)
member.summary: Tries to enqueue given object into the buffer.
member.returns: True if there was enough space to enqueue given object, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.Resize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Resizes the buffer so that it fits to given capacity. If new capacity is smaller than current capacity, then exceeding items are returned.
member.param: The new capacity of this buffer.
member.returns: All exceeding items.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectBuffer`1.TryRemove(`0)
member.summary: Tries to remove given object from the buffer.
member.returns: True if has been removed, false otherwise.

member.summary: An identifier which is unique inside the pool to which this object belongs. Moreover, this identifier increases monotonically as new objects are created.

member.summary: Payload which can be used to add custom information to a pooled object.

member.summary: Enumeration that is being managed by the pool to describe the object state - primary used to void cases where the resources are being releases twice.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectInfo.Handle
member.summary: Internal action that is initialized by the pool while creating the object, this allows that object to re-add itself back to the pool.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Diagnostics class for the current Object Pool, whose goal is to record data about how the pool operates. By default, however, an object pool records anything, in order to be most efficient; in any case, you can enable it through the property.

member.summary: Gets the count of the objects currently in the pool.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.PooledObject.ValidateObject(CodeProject.ObjectPool.Core.PooledObjectValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates pooled object state. An invalid object will not get into the pool and it will not be returned to consumers.
member.returns: True if current pooled object is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.PooledObject.ReleaseResources
member.summary: Releases the object resources. This method will be called by the pool manager when there is no need for this object anymore (decreasing pooled objects count, pool is being destroyed).

member.name: M:CodeProject.ObjectPool.PooledObject.ResetState
member.summary: Reset the object state. This method will be called by the pool manager just before the object is being returned to the pool.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.PooledObject.OnValidateObject
member.summary: Validates pooled object state. An invalid object will not get into the pool and it will not be returned to consumers.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.PooledObject.OnResetState
member.summary: Reset the object state to allow this object to be re-used by other parts of the application.

member.name: P:CodeProject.ObjectPool.PooledObject.OnReleaseResources
member.summary: Releases the object's resources.
